solution.text:
All rational numbers can be represented in the form of \(\frac{p}{q}\)
For example, \(\frac12=0.5\) which is terminating is a rational number. Also, \(\frac13=0.3333...\) which is non-terminating recurring is a rational number.
For a number to be irrational, it has to be non-terminating non-recurring.

content.text: Irrational numbers are always non-terminating non-recurring.
